sn54.1:4.4: “Mendicants, when one thing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.1:4.7: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
sn54.1:4.8: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down in the meditation posture, with their body erect, and establishes mindfulness right there.
sn54.1:4.9: Ever mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.
sn54.1:5.1: Breathing in deep they know: ‘I’m breathing in deep.’ Or breathing out deep they know: ‘I’m breathing out deep.’
sn54.1:5.2: Breathing in shallow they know: ‘I’m breathing in shallow.’ Or breathing out shallow they know: ‘I’m breathing out shallow.’
sn54.1:5.3: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing the whole body.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing the whole body.’
sn54.1:5.4: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in stilling physical processes.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out stilling physical processes.’
sn54.1:6.1: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing rapture.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing rapture.’
sn54.1:6.2: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing bliss.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing bliss.’
sn54.1:6.3: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing mental processes.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing mental processes.’
sn54.1:6.4: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in stilling mental processes.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out stilling mental processes.’
sn54.1:7.1: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing the mind.’
sn54.1:7.2: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in gladdening the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out gladdening the mind.’
sn54.1:7.3: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in converging the mind in samādhi.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out converging the mind in samādhi.’
sn54.1:7.4: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in freeing the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out freeing the mind.’
sn54.1:7.5: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing impermanence.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing impermanence.’
sn54.1:8.2: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing fading away.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing fading away.’
sn54.1:8.3: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing cessation.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing cessation.’
sn54.1:8.4: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’
sn54.1:9.1: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.”
